intro: Echidnopsis framesii, commonly known as the Grevillea of the Kalahari, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its unique, narrow leaves and showy, red-orange inflorescences. The plant is typically found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, nectar-rich flowers that attract pollinators such as birds and insects. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
